comments.body:
In my recent Ryu Double.toString PR, @densh asked me to do a cut & paste of the license terms to
LICENSE.txt (and leave copy here in place).  He may ask the same here.
I made a nice entry in the license file that I think is even up to your documentation standards ðŸ˜„
Bravo!   You even avoided the word `begat`.  If I were an IP lawyer I could trace that.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +-1,3 @@/*
 * Copyright (c) 2007-present, Stephen Colebourne & Michael Nascimento Santos
 *

comments.body:
I believe current scala best practice is to drop the  `: Long` type declaration?/ascription?   
It is probably not wrong, but is is also not Haskell minimalism.

I often use the type declaration in my development phase or debugging phase where I want
to ensure that the Right Hand Side is generating the type I expect.  I have been trained to delete
that code for final review.

Others may know better
On public definitions a return type is desired. I think too since procedure syntax going away that it is desired to add a return type to help the type safety and readability.

Sorry for my poor quoting skills. I was trying to refer to the line:
` val result: Long = Math.multiplyExact(seconds, Duration.MILLIS_PER_SEC)`.

This general idea happens in several places in the file.  Probably not worth another
edit & CI cycle.  I mentioned it because I was asked to be in super-picky line edit mode.

I concur that the return type in the def is indeed needed.
Oh, I see. I am not really sure if that is ok style or not but it is defensive for sure. If @densh doesn't like it I could still make some changes.
